description.p: These clothes have the ability to change into any style, color and type of clothing in appearence.
As an action you can change the appearence of your clothing.
The change is an illusion and as such does not grant you any bonuses to armor or any other benifits of a magical nature even if used to replicate the style of a magic attire.

As an action can change the appearence of your clothing.
The change is a physical one and can grant you the AC bonus if the new form is that of Armor provided you have that armor proficiency.
The clothing gains the weight of whatever form it is in.

This ring resembles a band of silver and gold with a yellow and red stone set into it. Casting identify reveals the following information (not the curse itself but if furhter research is done history shows that ever weilder of this ring has met an unseemly fate.) While attuned to this ring you can roll an additional 1d20 and add it to any skill check or attack roll made.
Curse. If the ring is used your DM rolls a 1d20 and subtracts their results from your overall total.
If remove curse or dispel is cast on this ring the powers bound in it fade away over 1d10 minutes and the ring reverts to a non-magical form.

description.p: This Spear appears to be like any other spear except to those who know how to use it. The spear when wielded by one trained in it's proper usage deals substantially more damage. When a user has proficiency in it's use successfully stabs it into another creature (IE does damage) it becomes exceedingly difficult to remove safely as barbs jut out of the spears end impaling the damaged creature. This causes an extra 3d6 slashing/piercing damage when pulled out. Once the weapon is pulled out in this manner the creature that took damamge must make a constituion save with a DC equal to damage dealt + 8 or be knocked unconsious by the pain (Undead, constructs and those that cannot feel pain are immunne to thsi affect.
